data.enText: money that is paid to sb so that they will set free a person who is being kept as a prisoner by them

data.chText: 绑架者向他的家人索要赎金5万英镑。
data.enText: The kidnappers demanded a ransom of £50 000 from his family.

data.chText: 索要赎金的要求 / 通知
他们拒绝支付赎金来解救她。
data.enText: They are refusing to pay ransom for her release.
to keep sb as a prisoner and demand that other people pay you an amount of money before you set them free
to take action that puts sb in a very difficult situation in order to force them to do what you want
a very large amount of money
to pay money to sb so that they will set free the person that they are keeping as a prisoner

data.chText: 被绑架的儿童在交付了赎金后均安然回到家中。
data.enText: The kidnapped children were all ransomed and returned home unharmed.
to keep sb as a prisoner and demand that other people pay you an amount of money before you set them free
to take action that puts sb in a very difficult situation in order to force them to do what you want
a very large amount of money

tr: the act of freeing from captivity or punishment
payment for the release of someone
money demanded for the return of a captured person
exchange or buy back for money

value.def: A ransom is the money that has to be paid to someone so that they will set free a person they have kidnapped.

example.ex: Her kidnapper successfully extorted a £75,000 ransom for her release...
example.tran: 绑匪成功地勒索了7.5万英镑才将她释放。

example.ex: The president has said the United States will never pay ransom for the hostages...
example.tran: 总统称美国永远不会为这些人质支付赎金。

example.ex: The ransom demand was made by telephone.
example.tran: 赎金是通过电话索要的。

value.def: If you ransom someone who has been kidnapped, you pay the money to set them free.

example.ex: The same system was used for ransoming or exchanging captives.
example.tran: 相同的制度还应用于赎回或交换俘虏。

value.def: If a kidnapper is holding someone to ransom or holding them ransom in British English, or is holding a person for ransom in American English, they keep that person prisoner until they are given what they want.

example.ex: He is charged with kidnapping a businessman last year and holding him for ransom...
example.tran: 他被控于去年绑架了一名商人并勒索钱财。

example.ex: In Rio, nearly forty people have been held to ransom this year alone...
example.tran: 在里约热内卢，仅今年一年就有近40人被绑票。

example.ex: A busload of schoolchildren were held ransom until the gang were given a plane.
example.tran: 直到给了绑匪们一架飞机，他们才将全车的学童们释放。

value.tran: 劫持（某人）勒索金钱;绑票;绑架

value.def: If you say that someone is holding you to ransom in British English, or holding you for ransom in American English, you mean that they are using their power to try to force you to do something which you do not want to do.

example.ex: Unison and the other unions have the power to hold the Government to ransom.
example.tran: 公务员工会和其他工会有能力胁迫政府。

value.def: If you refer to a sum of money as a king's ransom, you are emphasizing that it is very large.

example.ex: ...clients happy to pay a king's ransom for a haircut.
example.tran: 乐意为理发出高价的顾客

trans: 劫持（某人）勒索金钱;绑票;绑架
